dialogues.text: Mr. Perry pushes his way through the crowd of people, wit behind. MR. PERRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me. Excuse me. Excuse me. The boys notice Neil and try to dtop him to talk. CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Neil, Neil, you were great.  NEIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't, guys.  TODD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Neil! Neil! Outside of the crowd, Keating manages to catch up to Neil hold of Neil's coat. KEATING

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Neil. Neil. You have the gift. What a  performance You left even me speechless.  You have to stay with- Mr. Perry returns from his car and shoves Neil aside. MR. PERRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get in the car. Keating, you stay away  from my son.  CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Neil! Neil! Mr. Perry, come on.  KEATING

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't make it any worse than it is. Neil and Mr. Perry get into their car and drive away. Kea stares after them. CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is it okay if we walk back? Captain? Charlie motions Todd to follow. CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Knox. The boys leave and Keating continues to stare after the c the falling snow from his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A photo of Neil standing stiffly with his parents sits on between a glass of alcohol and a half filled ashtray. Mrs watches through the window as her husband and son arrive takes a nervous puff on her cigarette before sitting down Perry walks in with Neil close behind him. Neil sits down desk while Mr. Perry remains standing. MR. PERRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're trying very hard to understand why  it is that you insist on defying us.  Whatever the reason, we're not gonna let  you ruin your life. Tomorrow I'm  withdrawing you from Welton and  enrolling you in Braden Military School.  You're going to Harvard and you're gonna  be a doctor.  NEIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But that's ten more years. Father,  that's a lifetime!  MR. PERRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, stop it. Don't be so dramatic. You  make it sound like a prison term. You  don't understand, Neil. You have  opportunities that I never even dreamt  of and I am not going to let you waste  them. Neil rises to his feet. NEIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've got to tell you what I feel. Mrs. Perry stands up. MRS. PERRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've been so worried about--  MR. PERRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? What? Tell me what you feel. What  is it? Neil looks to his mother and then back to his father but nothing. MR. PERRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is it more of this, this acting  business? Because you can forget that.  What?  NEIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing. Neil sits back down dejectedly. MR. PERRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing? Well, then, let's go to bed. Mr. Perry leaves. Mrs. Perry pauses on her way out and kn behind Neil. NEIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was good. I was really good. Mrs. Perry nods slightly. MRS. PERRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go on, get some sleep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs. Perry sits on the side of the bed with her back to h husband. Mr. Perry removes his robe and slippers before getting in to bed. Mrs. Perry begins to cry as he turns o the light. MR. PERRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's all right. It's going to be all  right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Neil's pyjamas, bathrobe, towel, and shaving kit are all laid out on his bed. Neil touches his pyjamas lightly and removes his coat and shirt. He walks over to the windows opens them, taking several deep breaths. He places the cr twigs on his head and then closes his eyes, slowly lettin fall to his chest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A door opens and Neil emerges, slowly walking down the st in a trance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Neil holds a key in his hands. He unlocks a drawer in his desk and pulls out a pistol, wrapped in cloth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Perry jerks up out of bed, startled and breathing fas MR. PERRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What was that?  MRS. PERRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?  MR. PERRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That sound.  MRS. PERRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What sound? Tom? Mr. Perry turns on the light and gets up out of bed, putt robe and slippers. MRS. PERRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it? What's wrong?  Mr. Perry turns on the hallway light and knocks on Neil's the door and goes inside. MR. PERRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Neil. Mr. Perry notices the open window. MRS. PERRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom, what is it? What's wrong? Neil? Mr. Perry continues to look through the house, continuing MR. PERRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Neil? Mr. Perry notices the door to his study is ajar. MRS. PERRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll look outside. Neil? Mr. Perry flicks the light on but sees nothing. Then he s something. Looking closer, he sees a thin cloud of smoke behind his desk. As he moves around the desk he sees his floor and Neil's outstretched hand. MR. PERRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No! Mr. Perry crouches down by his son. MR. PERRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, Neil! Oh, my God! Mrs. Perry enters the room and sees her son. MRS. PERRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh! No!  MR. PERRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, my son!  MRS. PERRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's all right.  MR. PERRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My son! My poor son!  MRS. PERRY (crying hysterically)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's all right! He's all right! He's all  right! He's all right! He's all right!  He's all right!  MR. PERRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop it! Stop it! Stop it. Mr. Perry holds his wife and tries to comfort her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Todd is sleeping. Charlie reaches across to wake him. Tea running down his face. CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Todd? Todd. Todd, still half asleep, tries to shrug him off. TODD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, Charlie. Todd opens his eyes and sees Charlie's face TODD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it? Todd looks over to see Pitts, Meeks, and Knox by the door CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Neil's dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is a snowy, overcast morning. Todd walks through the s has his coat on over his pyjamas. The other boys follow c behind him as he walks down towards the water. He stops a out at the snow-covered surroundings. TODD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's so beautiful. Todd begins to gag and then goes down on his knees, vomit the snow. The other boys huddle around him, hugging him. CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Todd. It's okay, Todd.  PITTS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Calm down.  CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's all right, Todd.  PITTS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Todd, it's okay. It's okay, Todd.  CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's all right. It's alright. Charlie grabs a handful of snow and wipes Todd's mouth wi TODD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He wouldn't-- He wouldn't have done it.  MEEKS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't explain it, Todd.  TODD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was his father!  CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No!  TODD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He wouldn't have left us. It's because he- He wouldn't have. His dad was-- his, his  father did it.  CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Todd.  TODD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His father killed him. He made him do it. MEEKS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't explain it, Todd. Todd pushes himself away from the boys and stumbles down slipping and falling in the snow. MEEKS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Todd!  CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leave him be. The boys watch as Todd runs down towards the dock by the yelling and crying. He finally seems to regain control of and walks in silence out onto the dock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keating sits by himself at his desk. After a moment he ge and walks over to Neil's desk. Opening it, he finds his c of "Five Centuries of Verse" and flips through the first Sitting down at the desk, he returns to the opening page, the opening verse written there. Keating begins to sob, t the book.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A church service is going on. The boys have joined in the students in a hymn. Charlie is the only one not singing. off into nothingness. BOYS (singing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All my life  Thy light shall surely follow me  And in God's house forevermore  My dwelling place shall be  Amen. Mr. Nolan stands at the pulpit, with the rest of the prof seated behind him. MR. NOLAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The death of Neil Perry is a tragedy. He  was a fine student. One of Welton's  best. And he will be missed. We've  contacted each of your parents to  explain the situation. Naturally,  they're all quite concerned. At the  request of Neil's family, I intend to  conduct a thorough inquiry into this  matter. Your complete cooperation is  expected.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The boys (except Cameron) are sitting about the cluttered waiting. Charlie lights a cigarette. CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You told him about this meeting?  PITTS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Twice.  CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's it, guys. We're all fried.  PITTS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do you mean?  CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cameron's a fink. He's in Nolan's office  right now, finking.  PITTS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: About what?  CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The club, Pittsie. Think about it. The  board of directors, the trustees and Mr.  Nolan. Do you think for one moment  they're gonna let this thing just blow  over? Schools go down because of things  like this. They need a scapegoat. The door opens. All the boys except Charlie hurry to put their cigarettes out and wave the smoke away. A light com and Cameron enters. CAMERON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's going on, guys?  CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You finked, didn't you, Cameron? Charlie gets up and approaches Cameron, tossing his cigar CAMERON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Finked? I didn't know what the hell  you're talking about.  CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You told Nolan everything about the club  is what I'm talking about.  CAMERON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, in case you hadn't heard, Dalton,  there's something called an honor code  at this school, all right? If a teacher  asks you a question, you tell the truth  or you're expelled.  CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You little- Charlie lunges at Cameron but Knox and Meeks hold him bac MEEKS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlie!  CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's a rat! He's in it up to his eyes,  so he rattled to save himself.  KNOX

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't touch him, Charlie. You do and  you're out.  CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm out anyway!  KNOX

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't know that, not yet.  CAMERON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's right there, Charlie. And if you  guys are smart, you will do exactly what  I did and cooperate. They're not after  us. We're the victims. Us and Neil.  CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's that mean? Who are they after?  CAMERON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why, Mr. Keating, of course. The  "Captain" himself. I mean, you guys  didn't really think he could avoid  responsibility, did you?  CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Keating responsible for Neil? Is  that what they're saying?  CAMERON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, who else do you think, dumb ass?  The administration? Mr. Perry? Mr.  Keating put us up to all this crap,  didn't he? If he wasn't for Mr. Keating,  Neil would be cozied up in his room  right now, studying his chemistry and  dreaming of being called doctor.  TODD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That is not true, Cameron. You know  that. He didn't put us to anything. Neil  loved acting.  CAMERON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Believe what you want, but I say let  Keating fry. I mean, why ruin our lives? Charlie lunges at Cameron again and punches him in the fa Cameron falls to the floor as the boys pull Charlie away. lifts a hand to his bloody nose. CAMERON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You just signed your expulsion papers,  Nuwanda. Cameron rises to his feet. CAMERON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And if the rest of you are smart, you'll  do exactly what I did. They know  everything anyway. You can't save  Keating, but you can save yourselves. Cameron walks away, closing the door behind him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Todd looks out the window and watches as Hager escorts Me to the dorm. Inside the room, Neil's bed has been strippe its bedding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meeks walks slowly to his room. Hager remains standing at the hallway. HAGER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Knox Overstreet. Knox emerges from his room and goes to joing Hager. He gi up to Todd as he passes his door. Once he leaves with Hag over to Meeks' door. TODD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meeks?  MEEKS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go away. I have to study.  TODD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened to Nuwanda?  MEEKS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Expelled.  TODD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What'd you tell 'em?  MEEKS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing they didn't already know.  HAGER (O.S.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Todd Anderson.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Todd is lead up the steps to Mr. Nolan's office by Hager.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Todd enters the room to see his mother and father seated Mr. Nolan's desk. MR. ANDERSON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello, son.  MRS. ANDERSON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello, darling.  TODD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mom. THe door closes behind Todd. He remains standing, not kno what to do. MR. NOLAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have a seat, Mr. Anderson. Todd sits down next to his parents. MR. NOLAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Anderson, I think we've pretty well  put together what's happened here. You  do admit to being a part of this Dead  Poets Society? Todd says nothing. MR. ANDERSON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Answer him, Todd.  TODD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, sir. Mr. Nolan puts his glasses on and glances at a paper befo before removing his glasses once more. MR. NOLAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have here a detailed description of  what occurred at your meetings. It  describes how your teacher, Mr. Keating,  encouraged you boys to organize this  club and to use it as a source of  inspiration for reckless and self- indulgent behavior. It describes how Mr.  Keating, both in and out of the  classroom, encouraged Neil Perry to  follow his obsession with acting when he  knew all along it was against the  explicit order of Neil's parents. It was  Mr. Keating's blatant abuse of his  position as teacher that led directly to  Neil Perry's death.  Mr. Nolan motions to Todd's father, who passes along a sh paper to Todd. MR. NOLAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Read that document carefully, Todd. Very  carefully. Todd looks at the paper, which already contains the signa the other four boys. MR. NOLAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you've nothing to add or amend, sign  it.  TODD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's gonna happen to Mr. Keating?  MR. ANDERSON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've had enough. Sign the paper, Todd. Mr. Nolan holds out a pen for Todd to take.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. McAllister leads his students, textbooks in hand, thr snow outside the classrooms. McALLISTER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grass is gramen or herba. Lapis is  stone. The entire building is  aedificium. Keating looks out from his office window. McAllister paus up at Keating, giving him a brief wave. Keating waves bac

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keating laughs slightly as he watches McAllister from the Inside, all his belongings have been packed up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The students are all seated at their desks in silence. Ev as the door opens. They quickly stand as Mr. Nolan enters MR. NOLAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sit. The students sit once again as Mr. Nolan walks to the fro MR. NOLAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll be teaching this class through  exams. We'll find a permanent English  teacher during the break. Who will tell  me where you are in the Pritchard  textbook?  MR. NOLAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Anderson? TODD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh, in the, in the Pr-  MR. NOLAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't hear you, Mr. Anderson.  TODD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the, in the, in the Pritchard?  MR. NOLAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kindly inform me, Mr. Cameron.  CAMERON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We skipped around a lot, sir. We covered  the Romantics and some of the chapters  on Post Civil War literature.  MR. NOLAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about the Realists?  CAMERON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I believe we skipped most of that, sir.  MR. NOLAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right, then, we'll start over. What  is poetry? There is a knock at the classroom door. MR. NOLAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come. The students look back as the door opens. They quickly tu away when hey see it is Keating. KEATING

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me. I came for my personals.  Should I come back after class?  MR. NOLAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get them now, Mr. Keating.  MR. NOLAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gentlemen, turn to page 21 of the  introduction. Mr. Cameron, read aloud  the excellent essay by Dr. Pritchard on  "Understanding Poetry." Todd slowly closes his book. Keating opens the door to th room off the classroom. CAMERON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That page has been ripped out, sir.  MR. NOLAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, borrow somebody else's book.  CAMERON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're all ripped out, sir.  MR. NOLAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean, they're all ripped  out?  CAMERON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir, we, uh-  MR. NOLAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Never mind. Mr. Nolan takes his own book over to Cameron's desk and t slaps the open page. MR. NOLAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Read! As Cameron begins to read, Keating looks out at Todd as h his scarf on. Todd looks at him for a moment and then gla CAMERON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Understanding Poetry by Dr. J Evans  Pritchard, Ph.D. To fully understand  poetry, we must first be fluent with its  meter, rhyme and figures of speech, then  ask two questions: 1) How artfully has  the objective of the poem been rendered  and 2)..." The door squeaks as Keating shuts it behind him. Cameron CAMERON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "... How important is that objective?  Question 1 rates the poem's perfection;  question 2 rates its importance. And  once these questions have been answered,  determining the poem's greatness becomes  a relatively simple matter. If the  poem's score for perfection is plotted  on the horizontal of a graph--" Keating passes by Todd and the others and gets to the bac classroom before Todd leaps up from his seat and turns to TODD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Keating! They made everybody sign  it.  Mr. Nolan gets up from his desk and approaches Todd. MR. NOLAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quiet, Mr. Anderson.  TODD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You gotta believe me. It's true.  KEATING

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I do believe you, Todd.  MR. NOLAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leave, Mr. Keating.  TODD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But it wasn't his fault!  MR. NOLAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sit down, Mr. Anderson! Todd reluctantly returns to his seat. MR. NOLAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One more outburst from you or anyone else, and you're out of this school! Leave, Mr. Keating. Keating hesitates at the back of the classroom. MR. NOLAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I said leave, Mr. Keating. Keating slowly turns and heads to the door. As he opens it, Todd, stands upon his desk and turns to Keating. TODD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: O Captain! My Captain!  MR. NOLAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sit down, Mr. Anderson! Keating pauses at the door and looks back at Todd on his MR. NOLAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you hear me? Sit down! Sit down! This  is your final warning, Anderson. How  dare you? Do you hear me? After a moment of indecision, Knox climbs up onto his des KNOX

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: O Captain! My Captain!  MR. NOLAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Overstreet, I warn you! Sit down! Pitts climbs up onto his desk, followed by several others including Meeks. MR. NOLAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sit down! Sit down. All of you. I want  you seated. Sit down. Leave, Mr.  Keating. More students stand on their desks until half the class i MR. NOLAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All of you, down. I want you seated. Do  you hear me?  MR. NOLAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sit down!  Keating stands in the doorway, staring up at the boys in smile comes to his face. KEATING

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you, boys. Thank you.
